EagleDataType  type 
)

Check if a EagleDbSqlValue can be cast into a data type.

Parameters:
[in] value The value to cast (can be any type).
[in] type The data type to attempt to cast to.
Returns:
EagleTrue if the value can successfully be cast to the new type.

EagleDataTypeFloatType EagleDbSqlValue_getFloat ( EagleDbSqlValue *  value,
EagleBoolean *  success 
)

Get the float representation of a value.

Parameters:
[in] value The value.
[out] success Set ot EagleTrue if the returned value is correct.
Returns:
The float value of whatever the original type of the value was. If the value could now be cast then success will be set to EagleFalse and 0.0 will be returned.

Definition at line 190 of file EagleDbSqlValue.c.

00192     switch(value->type) {

00196         case EagleDbSqlValueTypeString:
00197             *success = EagleFalse;
00198             return 0.0;
00199             
00200         case EagleDbSqlValueTypeFloat:
00201             *success = EagleTrue;
00202             return value->value.floatValue;
00203             
00204         case EagleDbSqlValueTypeInteger:
00205             *success = EagleTrue;
00206             return (EagleDataTypeFloatType) value->value.intValue;
00207             
00208     }

EagleDbSqlValue* EagleDbSqlValue_NewWithString ( char *  str,
EagleBoolean  process 
)

Create a new EagleDbSqlValue with a string literal.

Parameters:
[in] str String value.
[in] process If this is EagleTrue then the string will be processed, ie remove the surrounding quotes and unescape inner quotes.
Returns:
A new EagleDbSqlValue instance.

00064     EagleDbSqlValue *v = (EagleDbSqlValue*) EagleMemory_Allocate("EagleDbSqlValue_NewWithString.1", sizeof(EagleDbSqlValue));
00065     if(NULL == v) {
00066         return NULL;

00068     
00069     v->expressionType = EagleDbSqlExpressionTypeValue;

00071     
00072     if(EagleFalse == process) {
00073         v->value.identifier = (NULL == str ? NULL : strdup(str));
00074     }
00075     else {
00076         /* process the string */
00077         unsigned long len, i, j;
00078         char *pstr;
00079         
00080         len = strlen(str);
00081         pstr = (char*) EagleMemory_Allocate("EagleDbSqlValue_NewWithString.2", len + 1);
00082         if(NULL == pstr) {
00083             EagleMemory_Free(v);
00084             return NULL;
00085         }
00086         
00087         for(i = 1, j = 0; i < len - 1; ++i, ++j) {
00088             if((str[i] == '\\' && str[i + 1] == '\'') || (str[i] == '\'' && str[i + 1] == '\'')) {
00089                 pstr[j] = '\'';
00090                 ++i;
00091             }
00092             else {
00093                 pstr[j] = str[i];
00094             }
00095         }
00096         pstr[len - 2] = '\0';
00097         
00098         v->value.identifier = (char*) pstr;
00099     }
00100     
00101     return v;
